properties.displayName: Front Door CDN should have Approved Minimum TLS Version

properties.displayName: Azure Load Balancer with no Backend Pools should be removed
properties.description: The backend pool is a critical componenet of Load Balancer since it defines the group of resources that will serve traffic for a given load-balancing rule. For more information, identify the 'Control Name' here: https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI. If an incident is related to following policy, please open an IcM incident via https://aka.ms/atb_support

nonComplianceMessages.message: This configuration is not compliant.  Please refer to 'Control ID Details Link' from https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI for more details.

properties.displayName: Use Approved TLS Version in App Services
properties.description: TLS provides privacy and data integrity between client and server. Using approved TLS version significantly reduces risks from security design issues and security bugs that may be present in older versions. For more information, identify the 'Control Name' here: https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI. If an incident is related to following policy, please open an IcM incident via https://aka.ms/atb_support

nonComplianceMessages.message: This configuration is not compliant.  Please refer to 'Control ID Details Link' from https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI for more details.

properties.displayName: App Services should use secure FTP deployments
properties.description: Deploying App Service code/configuration via unsecure FTP deployment connection would make the transmitted data/code vulnerable to network attacks like eavesdropping and tampering. For more information, identify the 'Control Name' here: https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI. If an incident is related to following policy, please open an IcM incident via https://aka.ms/atb_support

nonComplianceMessages.message: This configuration is not compliant.  Please refer to 'Control ID Details Link' from https://aka.ms/AzTBCnAI for more details.

properties.displayName: Use approved version of TLS for Azure Storage

properties.displayName: Configure Microsoft Defender CSPM plan
properties.description: Defender Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) provides enhanced posture capabilities and a new intelligent cloud security graph to help identify, prioritize, and reduce risk. Please contact Tier 2 Remediation Support through Service Now via https://aka.ms/ATB_Support. Under [Security Baseline – S360 KPI Name] select “1.05 Azure Tenant Security – Corp,” under [Control ID / Policy ID] select “Other,” and in the [Other Control ID] enter “Enabling Defender CSPM

properties.displayName: App Service apps should have local authentication methods disabled for FTP deployments
App Service app slots should have local authentication methods disabled for FTP deployments
App Service app slots should have local authentication methods disabled for SCM site deployments
App Service apps should have local authentication methods disabled for SCM site deployments
Configure App Service app to disable local authentication for FTP deployments and SCM sites
properties.description: The deployment connections make the transmitted data/code vulnerable to network attacks. Basic authentication is being disabled centrally for all internal applications to improve security posture. For more information navigate to https://eng.ms/cid/f05c4f52-a18d-45a3-87b2-b5d7cf0e5270/fid/6a39d57a2c596d043b5f18e2995b23da0bbc0fab4d1fa0952d0b767f864e2695. If an incident is related to the following policy, please open an IcM incident via https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v3/incidents/details/383328883/home

nonComplianceMessages.message: The resource has not complaint Basic Authentication configurations. If following policy is blocking your actions that have a valid security and business reason to remain non compliant, please add 'SkipBPCP' tagName with any value on your Web App. Make sure to follow up with an official exemption request via https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR9EtRz46cDVGn585Xp39USZUODk2QVBSWU9CMFpSN0NVOElWSFY5WlBaSy4u

properties.displayName: Azure Storage account access keys should rotate on periodic basis
properties.description: In response to a recent security incident, Microsoft recommends that you rotate your access keys periodically to keep your storage account secure. For more information, https://aka.ms/SecureAccessToStorageAccounts. If an incident is related to following policy, please open an incident via https://aka.ms/ATB_Support

nonComplianceMessages.message: This configuration is not compliant for the following policy: Azure Storage account access keys should rotate on periodic basis.  Please refer to https://aka.ms/SecureAccessToStorageAccounts for more details.

properties.displayName: Ensure secure access to storage account containers
properties.description: In response to a recent security incident, Microsoft recommends disabling public access which allows information to be downloaded by anyone on the internet without authentication and that can lead to a compromise of corporate data. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/SecureAccessToStorageAccounts. If an incident is related to following policy, please open an incident via https://aka.ms/ATB_Support

nonComplianceMessages.message: This configuration is not compliant to the following policy: Ensure secure access to storage account containers.  Please refer to https://aka.ms/SecureAccessToStorageAccounts for more details.

For more information, please see https://aka.ms/EnableVNetFlowLogsWiki. If you need to report an issue with this policy, please email VNetFlowLogSupport@microsoft.com
